title: Learning Trajectory-Based Simulation Education for Understanding Fraction Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and comprehension of decimal concepts
context.additional_context: Mathematical foundation enhancement program for science practitioners, emphasizing concept internalization through fraction manipulation and problem-solving in VR environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the conversion relationship between fractions and decimals with over 80% accuracy using visual tools.
Learners achieve a success rate of over 75% by applying fraction operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) to real-world problem scenarios through VR simulation.
Learners can analytically interpret at least three abstract representations of fraction concepts (e.g., bar graphs, pie charts) through stage-based learning trajectory assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
